meanings.definition: To guide or lead before; precede.
meanings.sent1: The map will preguide us to the treasure.
meanings.sent2: She likes to preguide her friends through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl decided to preguide the young birds on their first flight.
meanings.sent4: His intuition seemed to preguide him towards the correct decision.
meanings.sent5: The stars preguided the sailors safely back to shore.

meanings.definition: A guide or leader before others.
meanings.sent1: The preguide of the hiking group was experienced in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: She was chosen as the preguide for the school tour.
meanings.sent3: The little squirrel thought he was the preguide of the forest animals.
meanings.sent4: The ancient statue stood as a preguide for the entrance to the temple.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse served as a reliable preguide for ships in the night.
